1â†’/**
     2â†’ * Review data transformation processors.
     3â†’ * Adapts data between API format and UI component format.
     4â†’ */
     5â†’
     6â†’import { REVIEW_CATEGORIES } from '../../constants/reviewCategories.js';
     7â†’
     8â†’/**
     9â†’ * Initialize empty ratings array for form.
    10â†’ *
    11â†’ * @returns {Array<{categoryId: string, title: string, question: string, value: number}>}
    12â†’ */
    13â†’export function createEmptyRatings() {
    14â†’  return REVIEW_CATEGORIES.map(category => ({
    15â†’    categoryId: category.id,
    16â†’    title: category.title,
    17â†’    question: category.question,
    18â†’    value: 0
    19â†’  }));
    20â†’}
    21â†’
    22â†’/**
    23â†’ * Adapt form data to API submission format.
    24â†’ *
    25â†’ * @param {object} params - Named parameters.
    26â†’ * @param {string} params.guestId - Guest user ID.
    27â†’ * @param {string} params.hostId - Host user ID.
    28â†’ * @param {string} params.leaseId - Lease ID.
    29â†’ * @param {string} params.stayId - Stay ID.
    30â†’ * @param {Array<{categoryId: string, value: number}>} params.ratings - Rating data.
    31â†’ * @param {string} [params.feedback] - Optional feedback text.
    32â†’ * @param {number} params.overallScore - Calculated average score.
    33â†’ * @returns {object} API-formatted review object.
    34â†’ */
    35â†’export function adaptReviewForSubmission({
    36â†’  guestId,
    37â†’  hostId,
    38â†’  leaseId,
    39â†’  stayId,
    40â†’  ratings,
    41â†’  feedback,
    42â†’  overallScore
    43â†’}) {
    44â†’  if (!guestId || !hostId || !leaseId || !stayId) {
    45â†’    throw new Error('adaptReviewForSubmission: missing required IDs');
    46â†’  }
    47â†’
    48â†’  return {
    49â†’    guest_id: guestId,
    50â†’    host_id: hostId,
    51â†’    lease_id: leaseId,
    52â†’    stay_id: stayId,
    53â†’    ratings: ratings.map(r => ({
    54â†’      category_id: r.categoryId,
    55â†’      value: r.value
    56â†’    })),
    57â†’    overall_score: overallScore,
    58â†’    feedback: feedback || null,
    59â†’    created_at: new Date().toISOString()
    60â†’  };
    61â†’}
    62â†’
    63â†’/**
    64â†’ * Adapt API review data to UI display format.
    65â†’ *
    66â†’ * @param {object} params - Named parameters.
    67â†’ * @param {object} params.apiReview - Review from API.
    68â†’ * @returns {object} UI-formatted review object.
    69â†’ */
    70â†’export function adaptReviewFromApi({ apiReview }) {
    71â†’  if (!apiReview) {
    72â†’    return null;
    73â†’  }
    74â†’
    75â†’  return {
    76â†’    id: apiReview.id || apiReview._id,
    77â†’    guestId: apiReview.guest_id,
    78â†’    hostId: apiReview.host_id,
    79â†’    leaseId: apiReview.lease_id,
    80â†’    stayId: apiReview.stay_id,
    81â†’    ratings: (apiReview.ratings || []).map(r => ({
    82â†’      categoryId: r.category_id,

    84â†’      question: REVIEW_CATEGORIES.find(c => c.id === r.category_id)?.question || '',
    85â†’      value: r.value
    86â†’    })),
    87â†’    overallScore: apiReview.overall_score,
    88â†’    feedback: apiReview.feedback,
    89â†’    createdAt: apiReview.created_at
    90â†’  };
    91â†’}

/**
 * Process raw proposal data from Supabase into a clean, validated proposal object.
 *
 * @intent Transform raw proposal rows from Supabase into consistent, UI-ready format.
 * @rule NO FALLBACK - Throws explicit errors for missing critical fields.
 * @rule Merges original terms and counteroffer (host-changed) terms into single current terms.
 * @rule Handles dual proposal system (original vs host counteroffer).
 *
 * @param {object} params - Named parameters.
 * @param {object} params.rawProposal - Raw proposal object from Supabase.
 * @param {object} [params.listing] - Processed listing data (if already loaded).
 * @param {object} [params.guest] - Processed guest user data (if already loaded).
 * @param {object} [params.host] - Processed host user data (if already loaded).
 * @returns {object} Clean, validated proposal object with merged terms.
 *
 * @throws {Error} If rawProposal is null/undefined.
 * @throws {Error} If critical _id field is missing.
 * @throws {Error} If Listing or Guest reference is missing.
 *
 * @example
 * const proposal = processProposalData({
 *   rawProposal: {
 *     _id: 'abc123',
 *     Listing: 'listing123',
 *     Guest: 'user456',
 *     'Move-In Date': '2025-01-15',
 *     'Days of Week': [1, 2, 3],
 *     'hc Days of Week': null,
 *     'Proposal Status': 'Host Countered',
 *     ...
 *   }
 * })
 */
import { PROPOSAL_STATUSES, getUsualOrder } from '../../constants/proposalStatuses.js'

export function processProposalData({ rawProposal, listing = null, guest = null, host = null }) {
  // No Fallback: Proposal data must exist
  if (!rawProposal) {
    throw new Error('processProposalData: rawProposal cannot be null or undefined')
  }

  // Validate critical ID field
  if (!rawProposal._id) {
    throw new Error('processProposalData: Proposal missing critical _id field')
  }

  // Validate required foreign key references
  if (!rawProposal.Listing) {
    throw new Error(
      `processProposalData: Proposal ${rawProposal._id} missing required Listing reference`
    )
  }

  if (!rawProposal.Guest) {
    throw new Error(
      `processProposalData: Proposal ${rawProposal._id} missing required Guest reference`
    )
  }

  // Determine which terms are current (original or host-changed)
  const status = typeof rawProposal.Status === 'string'
    ? rawProposal.Status.trim()
    : (typeof rawProposal.status === 'string' ? rawProposal.status.trim() : 'Draft')

  const hasHostCounteroffer = status === PROPOSAL_STATUSES.COUNTEROFFER_SUBMITTED_AWAITING_GUEST_REVIEW.key.trim()

  // Merge terms: Use host-changed (hc) fields if they exist, otherwise use original
  const currentTerms = {
    moveInDate: hasHostCounteroffer && rawProposal['hc Move-In Date']
      ? rawProposal['hc Move-In Date']
      : rawProposal['Move-In Date'],

    daysOfWeek: hasHostCounteroffer && rawProposal['hc Days of Week']
      ? rawProposal['hc Days of Week']
      : rawProposal['Days of Week'],

    weeks: hasHostCounteroffer && rawProposal['hc Weeks']
      ? rawProposal['hc Weeks']
      : rawProposal.Weeks,

    totalRent: hasHostCounteroffer && rawProposal['hc Total Rent']
      ? rawProposal['hc Total Rent']
      : rawProposal['Total Rent'],

    cleaningFee: hasHostCounteroffer && rawProposal['hc Cleaning Fee']
      ? rawProposal['hc Cleaning Fee']
      : rawProposal['Cleaning Fee'],

    securityDeposit: hasHostCounteroffer && rawProposal['hc Security Deposit']
      ? rawProposal['hc Security Deposit']
      : rawProposal['Security Deposit'],

    houseRules: hasHostCounteroffer && rawProposal['hc House Rules']
      ? rawProposal['hc House Rules']
      : rawProposal['House Rules'],

    moveOutDate: hasHostCounteroffer && rawProposal['hc Move-Out Date']
      ? rawProposal['hc Move-Out Date']
      : rawProposal['Move-Out Date']
  }

  // Preserve original terms for comparison
  const originalTerms = {
    moveInDate: rawProposal['Move-In Date'],
    daysOfWeek: rawProposal['Days of Week'],
    weeks: rawProposal.Weeks,
    totalRent: rawProposal['Total Rent'],
    cleaningFee: rawProposal['Cleaning Fee'],
    securityDeposit: rawProposal['Security Deposit'],
    houseRules: rawProposal['House Rules'],
    moveOutDate: rawProposal['Move-Out Date']
  }

  return {
    // Identity
    id: rawProposal._id,
    listingId: rawProposal.Listing,
    guestId: rawProposal.Guest,

    // Status and workflow
    status,
    deleted: rawProposal.Deleted === true,
    usualOrder: getUsualOrder(status),

    // Current terms (merged from original or counteroffer)
    currentTerms,

    // Original terms (for comparison in Compare Terms modal)
    originalTerms,
    hasCounteroffer: hasHostCounteroffer,

    // Additional details
    virtualMeetingId: rawProposal['virtual meeting'] || null,
    houseManualAccessed: rawProposal['Did user access house manual?'] === true,

    // Cancellation
    cancellationReason: rawProposal['reason for cancellation'] || null,

    // Timestamps
    createdDate: rawProposal['Created Date'],
    modifiedDate: rawProposal['Modified Date'],

    // Enriched data (if provided)
    _listing: listing,
    _guest: guest,
    _host: host
  }
}

1â†’/**
     2â†’ * Proposal Data Processor
     3â†’ *
     4â†’ * PILLAR III: Data Processors (The "Truth" Layer)
     5â†’ *
     6â†’ * This processor transforms raw Supabase/Bubble.io data into clean,
     7â†’ * validated internal shapes. It enforces the "No Fallback" principle
     8â†’ * by throwing explicit errors for missing critical data.
     9â†’ *
    10â†’ * Intent: Create safe, typed objects for UI consumption, enforcing data integrity.
    11â†’ */
    12â†’
    13â†’/**
    14â†’ * Transform raw user data from Bubble.io format
    15â†’ * @param {Object} rawUser - Raw user object from Supabase
    16â†’ * @returns {Object} Transformed user object
    17â†’ */
    18â†’export function processUserData(rawUser) {
    19â†’  if (!rawUser) {
    20â†’    throw new Error('processUserData: User data is required');
    21â†’  }
    22â†’
    23â†’  if (!rawUser._id) {
    24â†’    throw new Error('processUserData: User ID (_id) is required');
    25â†’  }
    26â†’
    27â†’  return {
    28â†’    id: rawUser._id,
    29â†’    firstName: rawUser['Name - First'] || null,
    30â†’    lastName: rawUser['Name - Last'] || null,
    31â†’    fullName: rawUser['Name - Full'] || null,
    32â†’    profilePhoto: rawUser['Profile Photo'] || null,
    33â†’    bio: rawUser['About Me / Bio'] || null,
    34â†’    linkedInVerified: rawUser['Verify - Linked In ID'] || false,
    35â†’    phoneVerified: rawUser['Verify - Phone'] || false,
    36â†’    userVerified: rawUser['user verified?'] || false,
    37â†’    proposalsList: rawUser['Proposals List'] || []
    38â†’  };
    39â†’}
    40â†’
    41â†’/**
    42â†’ * Transform raw listing data from Bubble.io format
    43â†’ * @param {Object} rawListing - Raw listing object from Supabase
    44â†’ * @returns {Object} Transformed listing object
    45â†’ */
    46â†’export function processListingData(rawListing) {
    47â†’  if (!rawListing) {
    48â†’    return null;
    49â†’  }
    50â†’
    51â†’  // Extract address from JSONB structure
    52â†’  const addressData = rawListing['Location - Address'];
    53â†’  const addressString = typeof addressData === 'object' && addressData?.address
    54â†’    ? addressData.address
    55â†’    : (typeof addressData === 'string' ? addressData : null);
    56â†’
    57â†’  return {
    58â†’    id: rawListing._id,
    59â†’    name: rawListing.Name || 'Untitled Listing',
    60â†’    description: rawListing.Description || null,
    61â†’    address: addressString,
    62â†’    addressData: addressData, // Keep full JSONB for map coordinates
    63â†’    borough: rawListing['Location - Borough'] || null,
    64â†’    hood: rawListing['Location - Hood'] || null,
    65â†’    boroughName: rawListing.boroughName || null, // Resolved name from lookup table
    66â†’    hoodName: rawListing.hoodName || null, // Resolved name from lookup table
    67â†’    photos: rawListing['Features - Photos'] || [],
    68â†’    featuredPhotoUrl: rawListing.featuredPhotoUrl || null,
    69â†’    houseRules: rawListing.houseRules || [],
    70â†’    checkInTime: rawListing['NEW Date Check-in Time'] || null,
    71â†’    checkOutTime: rawListing['NEW Date Check-out Time'] || null,
    72â†’    hostUserId: rawListing['Host User'] || null
    73â†’  };
    74â†’}
    75â†’
    76â†’/**
    77â†’ * Transform raw host data from Bubble.io format
    78â†’ * @param {Object} rawHost - Raw host object from Supabase
    79â†’ * @returns {Object} Transformed host object
    80â†’ */
    81â†’export function processHostData(rawHost) {
    82â†’  if (!rawHost) {
    83â†’    return null;
    84â†’  }
    85â†’
    86â†’  return {
    87â†’    id: rawHost._id,
    88â†’    firstName: rawHost['Name - First'] || null,
    89â†’    lastName: rawHost['Name - Last'] || null,
    90â†’    fullName: rawHost['Name - Full'] || null,
    91â†’    profilePhoto: rawHost['Profile Photo'] || null,
    92â†’    bio: rawHost['About Me / Bio'] || null,
    93â†’    linkedInVerified: rawHost['Verify - Linked In ID'] || false,
    94â†’    phoneVerified: rawHost['Verify - Phone'] || false,
    95â†’    userVerified: rawHost['user verified?'] || false,
    96â†’    // hostUserId same as user._id after migration (Host User column contains user._id directly)
    97â†’    hostUserId: rawHost._id || null
    98â†’  };
    99â†’}
   100â†’
   101â†’/**
   102â†’ * Transform raw virtual meeting data from Bubble.io format
   103â†’ * @param {Object} rawVirtualMeeting - Raw virtual meeting object from Supabase
   104â†’ * @returns {Object} Transformed virtual meeting object
   105â†’ */
   106â†’export function processVirtualMeetingData(rawVirtualMeeting) {
   107â†’  if (!rawVirtualMeeting) {
   108â†’    return null;
   109â†’  }
   110â†’
   111â†’  return {
   112â†’    id: rawVirtualMeeting._id,
   113â†’    bookedDate: rawVirtualMeeting['booked date'] || null,
   114â†’    confirmedBySplitlease: rawVirtualMeeting.confirmedBySplitLease || false,
   115â†’    meetingLink: rawVirtualMeeting['meeting link'] || null,
   116â†’    meetingDeclined: rawVirtualMeeting['meeting declined'] || false,
   117â†’    requestedBy: rawVirtualMeeting['requested by'] || null,
   118â†’    suggestedTimeslots: rawVirtualMeeting['suggested dates and times'] || [],
   119â†’    guestName: rawVirtualMeeting['guest name'] || null,
   120â†’    hostName: rawVirtualMeeting['host name'] || null,
   121â†’    proposalId: rawVirtualMeeting.proposal || null,
   122â†’    uniqueId: rawVirtualMeeting.unique_id || null
   123â†’  };
   124â†’}
   125â†’
   126â†’/**
   127â†’ * Transform complete proposal data from Bubble.io format
   128â†’ * Includes nested transformations for listing, host, and virtual meeting
   129â†’ *
   130â†’ * @param {Object} rawProposal - Raw proposal object from Supabase
   131â†’ * @returns {Object} Transformed proposal object
   132â†’ */
   133â†’export function processProposalData(rawProposal) {
   134â†’  if (!rawProposal) {
   135â†’    throw new Error('processProposalData: Proposal data is required');
   136â†’  }
   137â†’
   138â†’  if (!rawProposal._id) {
   139â†’    throw new Error('processProposalData: Proposal ID (_id) is required');
   140â†’  }
   141â†’
   142â†’  // Extract and transform nested data
   143â†’  const listing = processListingData(rawProposal.listing);
   144â†’  const host = processHostData(rawProposal.listing?.host);
   145â†’  const virtualMeeting = processVirtualMeetingData(rawProposal.virtualMeeting);
   146â†’
   147â†’  return {
   148â†’    // Core identifiers
   149â†’    id: rawProposal._id,
   150â†’    _id: rawProposal._id, // Keep for compatibility
   151â†’
   152â†’    // Status and state
   153â†’    status: rawProposal.Status || 'Unknown',
   154â†’    deleted: rawProposal.Deleted || false,
   155â†’
   156â†’    // Schedule - Original proposal terms
   157â†’    daysSelected: rawProposal['Days Selected'] || [],
   158â†’    nightsSelected: rawProposal['Nights Selected (Nights list)'] || [],
   159â†’    reservationWeeks: rawProposal['Reservation Span (Weeks)'] || 0,
   160â†’    nightsPerWeek: rawProposal['nights per week (num)'] || 0,
   161â†’    checkInDay: rawProposal['check in day'] || null,
   162â†’    checkOutDay: rawProposal['check out day'] || null,
   163â†’    moveInStart: rawProposal['Move in range start'] || null,
   164â†’    moveInEnd: rawProposal['Move in range end'] || null,
   165â†’
   166â†’    // Pricing - Original proposal terms
   167â†’    totalPrice: rawProposal['Total Price for Reservation (guest)'] || 0,
   168â†’    nightlyPrice: rawProposal['proposal nightly price'] || 0,
   169â†’    cleaningFee: rawProposal['cleaning fee'] || 0,
   170â†’    damageDeposit: rawProposal['damage deposit'] || 0,
   171â†’
   172â†’    // Counteroffer fields (hc = host-changed)
   173â†’    counterOfferHappened: rawProposal['counter offer happened'] || false,
   174â†’    hcDaysSelected: rawProposal['hc days selected'] || null,
   175â†’    hcReservationWeeks: rawProposal['hc reservation span (weeks)'] || null,
   176â†’    hcNightsPerWeek: rawProposal['hc nights per week'] || null,
   177â†’    hcCheckInDay: rawProposal['hc check in day'] || null,
   178â†’    hcCheckOutDay: rawProposal['hc check out day'] || null,
   179â†’    hcTotalPrice: rawProposal['hc total price'] || null,
   180â†’    hcNightlyPrice: rawProposal['hc nightly price'] || null,
   181â†’    hcCleaningFee: rawProposal['hc cleaning fee'] || null,
   182â†’    hcDamageDeposit: rawProposal['hc damage deposit'] || null,
   183â†’    hcHouseRules: rawProposal['hc house rules'] || null,
   184â†’
   185â†’    // Metadata
   186â†’    createdDate: rawProposal['Created Date'] || null,
   187â†’    modifiedDate: rawProposal['Modified Date'] || null,
   188â†’    aboutYourself: rawProposal.about_yourself || null,
   189â†’    specialNeeds: rawProposal.special_needs || null,
   190â†’    reasonForCancellation: rawProposal['reason for cancellation'] || null,
   191â†’    proposalStage: rawProposal['Proposal Stage'] || null,
   192â†’    isFinalized: rawProposal['Is Finalized'] || false,
   193â†’    isSuggestedByHost: rawProposal['Is Suggested by Host'] || false,
   194â†’
   195â†’    // Related IDs
   196â†’    guestId: rawProposal.Guest || null,
   197â†’    listingId: rawProposal.Listing || null,
   198â†’    rentalApplicationId: rawProposal['rental application'] || null,
   199â†’    virtualMeetingId: rawProposal['virtual meeting'] || null,
   200â†’
   201â†’    // Nested transformed data
   202â†’    listing,
   203â†’    host,
   204â†’    virtualMeeting,
   205â†’
   206â†’    // House rules (resolved from listing or counteroffer)
   207â†’    houseRules: rawProposal.houseRules || listing?.houseRules || []
   208â†’  };
   209â†’}
   210â†’
   211â†’/**
   212â†’ * Get display text for proposal in dropdown
   213â†’ * Format: "{host name} - {listing name}"
   214â†’ * Shows the host who owns the listing, allowing guests to identify proposals by host
   215â†’ *
   216â†’ * @param {Object} proposal - Transformed proposal object
   217â†’ * @returns {string} Display text for dropdown option
   218â†’ */
   219â†’export function getProposalDisplayText(proposal) {
   220â†’  if (!proposal) return 'Unknown Proposal';
   221â†’
   222â†’  const hostName = proposal.host?.firstName || proposal.host?.fullName || 'Host';
   223â†’  const listingName = proposal.listing?.name || 'Property';
   224â†’
   225â†’  return `${hostName} - ${listingName}`;
   226â†’}
   227â†’
   228â†’/**
   229â†’ * Format price for display
   230â†’ * @param {number} price - Price value
   231â†’ * @param {boolean} includeCents - Whether to include cents
   232â†’ * @returns {string} Formatted price string
   233â†’ */
   234â†’export function formatPrice(price, includeCents = true) {
   235â†’  if (price === null || price === undefined) return null;
   236â†’
   237â†’  const formatter = new Intl.NumberFormat('en-US', {
   238â†’    style: 'currency',
   239â†’    currency: 'USD',
   240â†’    minimumFractionDigits: includeCents ? 2 : 0,
   241â†’    maximumFractionDigits: includeCents ? 2 : 0
   242â†’  });
   243â†’
   244â†’  return formatter.format(price);
   245â†’}
   246â†’
   247â†’/**
   248â†’ * Format date for display
   249â†’ * @param {string|Date} date - Date value
   250â†’ * @returns {string} Formatted date string
   251â†’ */
   252â†’export function formatDate(date) {
   253â†’  if (!date) return null;
   254â†’
   255â†’  const dateObj = typeof date === 'string' ? new Date(date) : date;
   256â†’
   257â†’  if (isNaN(dateObj.getTime())) return null;
   258â†’
   259â†’  return dateObj.toLocaleDateString('en-US', {
   260â†’    year: 'numeric',
   261â†’    month: 'short',
   262â†’    day: 'numeric'
   263â†’  });
   264â†’}
   265â†’
   266â†’/**
   267â†’ * Format datetime for display
   268â†’ * @param {string|Date} datetime - Datetime value
   269â†’ * @returns {string} Formatted datetime string
   270â†’ */
   271â†’export function formatDateTime(datetime) {
   272â†’  if (!datetime) return null;
   273â†’
   274â†’  const dateObj = typeof datetime === 'string' ? new Date(datetime) : datetime;
   275â†’
   276â†’  if (isNaN(dateObj.getTime())) return null;
   277â†’
   278â†’  return dateObj.toLocaleString('en-US', {
   279â†’    weekday: 'long',
   280â†’    year: 'numeric',
   281â†’    month: 'long',
   282â†’    day: 'numeric',
   283â†’    hour: 'numeric',
   284â†’    minute: '2-digit',
   285â†’    timeZone: 'America/New_York',
   286â†’    timeZoneName: 'short'
   287â†’  });
   288â†’}
   289â†’
   290â†’/**
   291â†’ * Get the effective terms for a proposal (counteroffer if exists, otherwise original)
   292â†’ * @param {Object} proposal - Transformed proposal object
   293â†’ * @returns {Object} Effective terms object
   294â†’ */
   295â†’export function getEffectiveTerms(proposal) {
   296â†’  if (!proposal) {
   297â†’    throw new Error('getEffectiveTerms: Proposal is required');
   298â†’  }
   299â†’
   300â†’  // If counteroffer happened and has values, use those
   301â†’  if (proposal.counterOfferHappened) {
   302â†’    return {
   303â†’      daysSelected: proposal.hcDaysSelected || proposal.daysSelected,
   304â†’      reservationWeeks: proposal.hcReservationWeeks || proposal.reservationWeeks,
   305â†’      nightsPerWeek: proposal.hcNightsPerWeek || proposal.nightsPerWeek,
   306â†’      checkInDay: proposal.hcCheckInDay || proposal.checkInDay,
   307â†’      checkOutDay: proposal.hcCheckOutDay || proposal.checkOutDay,
   308â†’      totalPrice: proposal.hcTotalPrice || proposal.totalPrice,
   309â†’      nightlyPrice: proposal.hcNightlyPrice || proposal.nightlyPrice,
   310â†’      cleaningFee: proposal.hcCleaningFee || proposal.cleaningFee,
   311â†’      damageDeposit: proposal.hcDamageDeposit || proposal.damageDeposit,
   312â†’      isCounteroffer: true
   313â†’    };
   314â†’  }
   315â†’
   316â†’  // Otherwise use original terms
   317â†’  return {
   318â†’    daysSelected: proposal.daysSelected,
   319â†’    reservationWeeks: proposal.reservationWeeks,
   320â†’    nightsPerWeek: proposal.nightsPerWeek,
   321â†’    checkInDay: proposal.checkInDay,
   322â†’    checkOutDay: proposal.checkOutDay,
   323â†’    totalPrice: proposal.totalPrice,
   324â†’    nightlyPrice: proposal.nightlyPrice,
   325â†’    cleaningFee: proposal.cleaningFee,
   326â†’    damageDeposit: proposal.damageDeposit,
   327â†’    isCounteroffer: false
   328â†’  };
   329â†’}

1â†’/**
     2â†’ * Workflow: Cancel a proposal with complex decision tree.
     3â†’ *
     4â†’ * @intent Orchestrate proposal cancellation following business rules.
     5â†’ * @rule Implements complete cancellation decision tree (7 variations).
     6â†’ * @rule Different actions based on: source, current status, usual order, house manual access.
     7â†’ * @rule Updates Supabase with appropriate status and cancellation reason.
     8â†’ *
     9â†’ * Decision Tree (from WORKFLOW-PASS2-ASSIMILATION.md):
    10â†’ * 1. Already cancelled â†’ Show alert, no action
    11â†’ * 2. Compare modal source + Usual Order â‰¤5 â†’ Status: "Cancelled by Guest"
    12â†’ * 3. Compare modal source + Usual Order >5 â†’ Alert to call, no DB update
    13â†’ * 4. Main page + Usual Order â‰¤5 + No house manual â†’ Status: "Cancelled by Guest"
    14â†’ * 5. Main page + Usual Order >5 + No house manual â†’ Alert to call, no DB update
    15â†’ * 6. Main page + Usual Order â‰¤5 + Has house manual â†’ Alert to call, no DB update
    16â†’ * 7. Main page + Usual Order >5 + Has house manual â†’ Alert to call, no DB update
    17â†’ *
    18â†’ * @param {object} params - Named parameters.
    19â†’ * @param {object} params.supabase - Supabase client instance.
    20â†’ * @param {object} params.proposal - Processed proposal object.
    21â†’ * @param {string} params.source - 'main' | 'compare-modal' | 'other'.
    22â†’ * @param {function} params.canCancelProposal - Rule function to check if cancellable.
    23â†’ * @returns {Promise<object>} Result object with success status and message.
    24â†’ *
    25â†’ * @throws {Error} If required parameters are missing.
    26â†’ *
    27â†’ * @example
    28â†’ * const result = await cancelProposalWorkflow({
    29â†’ *   supabase,
    30â†’ *   proposal: processedProposal,
    31â†’ *   source: 'main',
    32â†’ *   canCancelProposal
    33â†’ * })
    34â†’ * // => { success: true, message: 'Proposal cancelled', updated: true }
    35â†’ */
    36â†’import { PROPOSAL_STATUSES } from '../../constants/proposalStatuses.js'
    37â†’
    38â†’export async function cancelProposalWorkflow({
    39â†’  supabase,
    40â†’  proposal,
    41â†’  source = 'main',
    42â†’  canCancelProposal
    43â†’}) {
    44â†’  // Validation
    45â†’  if (!supabase) {
    46â†’    throw new Error('cancelProposalWorkflow: supabase client is required')
    47â†’  }
    48â†’
    49â†’  if (!proposal || !proposal.id) {
    50â†’    throw new Error('cancelProposalWorkflow: proposal with id is required')
    51â†’  }
    52â†’
    53â†’  if (!canCancelProposal) {
    54â†’    throw new Error('cancelProposalWorkflow: canCancelProposal rule function is required')
    55â†’  }
    56â†’
    57â†’  // Step 1: Check if cancellation is allowed
    58â†’  const canCancel = canCancelProposal({
    59â†’    proposalStatus: proposal.status,
    60â†’    deleted: proposal.deleted
    61â†’  })
    62â†’
    63â†’  if (!canCancel) {
    64â†’    return {
    65â†’      success: false,
    66â†’      message: 'This proposal cannot be cancelled (already in terminal state)',
    67â†’      updated: false
    68â†’    }
    69â†’  }
    70â†’
    71â†’  // Step 2: Extract decision factors
    72â†’  const usualOrder = proposal.usualOrder || 0
    73â†’  const hasAccessedHouseManual = proposal.houseManualAccessed === true
    74â†’  const isFromCompareModal = source === 'compare-modal'
    75â†’
    76â†’  // Step 3: Apply decision tree
    77â†’  let shouldUpdateDatabase = false
    78â†’  let alertMessage = null
    79â†’
    80â†’  if (isFromCompareModal) {
    81â†’    // Compare Modal Source
    82â†’    if (usualOrder <= 5) {
    83â†’      // Variation 2: Update database
    84â†’      shouldUpdateDatabase = true
    85â†’    } else {
    86â†’      // Variation 3: Alert to call
    87â†’      alertMessage = 'Please call Split Lease to cancel this proposal (Usual Order > 5)'
    88â†’    }
    89â†’  } else {
    90â†’    // Main Page Source
    91â†’    if (!hasAccessedHouseManual) {
    92â†’      if (usualOrder <= 5) {
    93â†’        // Variation 4: Update database
    94â†’        shouldUpdateDatabase = true
    95â†’      } else {
    96â†’        // Variation 5: Alert to call
    97â†’        alertMessage = 'Please call Split Lease to cancel this proposal (Usual Order > 5)'
    98â†’      }
    99â†’    } else {
   100â†’      // Has accessed house manual - always alert to call (Variations 6 & 7)
   101â†’      alertMessage = 'Please call Split Lease to cancel this proposal (House Manual accessed)'
   102â†’    }
   103â†’  }
   104â†’
   105â†’  // Step 4: Execute action
   106â†’  if (shouldUpdateDatabase) {
   107â†’    try {
   108â†’      const { error } = await supabase
   109â†’        .from('proposal')
   110â†’        .update({
   111â†’          'Status': PROPOSAL_STATUSES.CANCELLED_BY_GUEST.key,
   112â†’          'reason for cancellation': 'Guest initiated cancellation',
   113â†’          'Modified Date': new Date().toISOString()
   114â†’        })
   115â†’        .eq('_id', proposal.id)
   116â†’
   117â†’      if (error) {
   118â†’        throw error
   119â†’      }
   120â†’
   121â†’      return {
   122â†’        success: true,
   123â†’        message: 'Proposal cancelled successfully',
   124â†’        updated: true
   125â†’      }
   126â†’    } catch (err) {
   127â†’      return {
   128â†’        success: false,
   129â†’        message: `Failed to cancel proposal: ${err.message}`,
   130â†’        updated: false,
   131â†’        error: err
   132â†’      }
   133â†’    }
   134â†’  } else {
   135â†’    // Alert only, no database update
   136â†’    return {
   137â†’      success: true,
   138â†’      message: alertMessage,
   139â†’      updated: false,
   140â†’      requiresPhoneCall: true
   141â†’    }
   142â†’  }
   143â†’}
   144â†’

     4â†’
     5â†’/**
     6â†’ * Validate a proposed move-in date against listing availability and schedule.
     7â†’ * Orchestrates multiple validation rules.
     8â†’ *
     9â†’ * @intent Enforce all business rules for move-in date selection.
    10â†’ * @rule Move-in date cannot be in the past.
    11â†’ * @rule Move-in date must be within listing's available date range.
    12â†’ * @rule Move-in date cannot be on a blocked date.
    13â†’ * @rule Move-in date's day-of-week must match the selected schedule's check-in day.
    14â†’ *
    15â†’ * @param {object} params - Named parameters.
    16â†’ * @param {Date} params.moveInDate - Proposed move-in date.
    17â†’ * @param {object} params.listing - Listing object with availability data.
    18â†’ * @param {string|Date} [params.listing.firstAvailable] - First available date.
    19â†’ * @param {string|Date} [params.listing.lastAvailable] - Last available date.
    20â†’ * @param {Array} [params.listing.blockedDates] - Array of blocked dates.
    21â†’ * @param {number[]} params.selectedDayIndices - Selected days of week (0-6).
    22â†’ * @returns {object} Validation result with valid flag, errorCode, and details.
    23â†’ *
    24â†’ * @throws {Error} If moveInDate is not a valid Date.
    25â†’ * @throws {Error} If listing is not provided.
    26â†’ * @throws {Error} If selectedDayIndices is invalid.
    27â†’ *
    28â†’ * @example
    29â†’ * const result = validateMoveInDateWorkflow({
    30â†’ *   moveInDate: new Date('2025-12-15'),
    31â†’ *   listing: { firstAvailable: '2025-12-01', lastAvailable: '2026-01-31', blockedDates: [] },
    32â†’ *   selectedDayIndices: [1, 2, 3, 4, 5] // Mon-Fri
    33â†’ * })
    34â†’ * // => { valid: true, errorCode: null } (Dec 15 is a Monday)
    35â†’ */
    36â†’export function validateMoveInDateWorkflow({ moveInDate, listing, selectedDayIndices }) {
    37â†’  // No Fallback: Validate inputs
    38â†’  if (!(moveInDate instanceof Date) || isNaN(moveInDate.getTime())) {
    39â†’    throw new Error(
    40â†’      'validateMoveInDateWorkflow: moveInDate must be a valid Date object'
    41â†’    )
    42â†’  }
    43â†’
    44â†’  if (!listing || typeof listing !== 'object') {
    45â†’    throw new Error(
    46â†’      'validateMoveInDateWorkflow: listing is required'
    47â†’    )
    48â†’  }
    49â†’
    50â†’  if (!Array.isArray(selectedDayIndices)) {
    51â†’    throw new Error(
    52â†’      'validateMoveInDateWorkflow: selectedDayIndices must be an array'
    53â†’    )
    54â†’  }
    55â†’
    56â†’  // Check if date is in the past
    57â†’  const today = new Date()
    58â†’  today.setHours(0, 0, 0, 0)
    59â†’  const checkDate = new Date(moveInDate)
    60â†’  checkDate.setHours(0, 0, 0, 0)
    61â†’
    62â†’  if (checkDate < today) {
    63â†’    return {
    64â†’      valid: false,
    65â†’      errorCode: 'MOVE_IN_DATE_IN_PAST'
    66â†’    }
    67â†’  }
    68â†’
    69â†’  // Check if date is within available range
    70â†’  const inRange = isDateInRange({
    71â†’    date: moveInDate,
    72â†’    firstAvailable: listing.firstAvailable || listing['First Available'],
    73â†’    lastAvailable: listing.lastAvailable || listing['Last Available']
    74â†’  })
    75â†’
    76â†’  if (!inRange) {
    77â†’    return {
    78â†’      valid: false,
    79â†’      errorCode: 'MOVE_IN_DATE_OUTSIDE_RANGE',
    80â†’      firstAvailable: listing.firstAvailable || listing['First Available'],
    81â†’      lastAvailable: listing.lastAvailable || listing['Last Available']
    82â†’    }
    83â†’  }
    84â†’
    85â†’  // Check if date is blocked
    86â†’  const blockedDates = listing.blockedDates || listing['Dates - Blocked'] || []
    87â†’  const isBlocked = isDateBlocked({
    88â†’    date: moveInDate,
    89â†’    blockedDates
    90â†’  })
    91â†’
    92â†’  if (isBlocked) {
    93â†’    return {
    94â†’      valid: false,
    95â†’      errorCode: 'MOVE_IN_DATE_BLOCKED'
    96â†’    }
    97â†’  }
    98â†’
    99â†’  // Check if move-in date's day-of-week matches selected schedule
   100â†’  if (selectedDayIndices.length > 0) {
   101â†’    const { checkInDay } = calculateCheckInOutDays({ selectedDays: selectedDayIndices })
   102â†’    const moveInDayOfWeek = moveInDate.getDay()
   103â†’
   104â†’    if (checkInDay !== moveInDayOfWeek) {
   105â†’      const DAY_NAMES = ['Sunday', 'Monday', 'Tuesday', 'Wednesday', 'Thursday', 'Friday', 'Saturday']
   106â†’
   107â†’      return {
   108â†’        valid: false,
   109â†’        errorCode: 'MOVE_IN_DAY_MISMATCH',
   110â†’        expectedDayOfWeek: checkInDay,
   111â†’        expectedDayName: DAY_NAMES[checkInDay],
   112â†’        actualDayOfWeek: moveInDayOfWeek,
   113â†’        actualDayName: DAY_NAMES[moveInDayOfWeek]
   114â†’      }
   115â†’    }
   116â†’  }
   117â†’
   118â†’  // All validations passed
   119â†’  return {
   120â†’    valid: true,
   121â†’    errorCode: null
   122â†’  }
   123â†’}
   124â†’

     8â†’
     9â†’  /** Site markup applied to all bookings as decimal */

    11â†’
    12â†’  /** Minimum nights for full-time discount eligibility */

    14â†’
    15â†’  /** Valid night range for pricing calculations */

    22â†’

1â†’/**
     2â†’ * Calculate guest-facing price per night after markup and discounts.
     3â†’ * This is the price displayed on listing cards in search results.
     4â†’ *
     5â†’ * @intent Calculate final guest-facing price from host compensation rate.
     6â†’ * @rule Apply 13% full-time discount for 7 nights only.
     7â†’ * @rule Apply 17% site markup to all prices.
     8â†’ * @rule Return price per night (total price / nights).
     9â†’ *
    10â†’ * Formula:
    11â†’ * 1. Base price = host rate Ã— nights
    12â†’ * 2. Full-time discount = base price Ã— 0.13 (only if 7 nights)
    13â†’ * 3. Price after discounts = base price - discount
    14â†’ * 4. Site markup = price after discounts Ã— 0.17
    15â†’ * 5. Total price = base price - discount + markup
    16â†’ * 6. Price per night = total price / nights
    17â†’ *
    18â†’ * @param {object} params - Named parameters.
    19â†’ * @param {number} params.hostNightlyRate - Host compensation rate per night.
    20â†’ * @param {number} params.nightsCount - Number of nights selected (2-7).
    21â†’ * @returns {number} Guest-facing price per night.
    22â†’ *
    23â†’ * @throws {Error} If hostNightlyRate is not a valid positive number.
    24â†’ * @throws {Error} If nightsCount is not between 2-7.
    25â†’ *
    26â†’ * @example
    27â†’ * const price = calculateGuestFacingPrice({ hostNightlyRate: 100, nightsCount: 5 })
    28â†’ * // => 117 (per night, after markup)
    29â†’ *
    30â†’ * const fullWeekPrice = calculateGuestFacingPrice({ hostNightlyRate: 100, nightsCount: 7 })
    31â†’ * // => 102.35 (per night, with 13% discount + 17% markup)
    32â†’ */
    33â†’import { PRICING_CONSTANTS } from '../../constants/pricingConstants.js';
    34â†’
    35â†’export function calculateGuestFacingPrice({ hostNightlyRate, nightsCount }) {
    36â†’  // No Fallback: Strict validation
    37â†’  if (
    38â†’    typeof hostNightlyRate !== 'number' ||
    39â†’    isNaN(hostNightlyRate) ||
    40â†’    hostNightlyRate < 0
    41â†’  ) {
    42â†’    throw new Error(
    43â†’      `calculateGuestFacingPrice: hostNightlyRate must be a positive number, got ${hostNightlyRate}`
    44â†’    )
    45â†’  }
    46â†’
    47â†’  if (
    48â†’    typeof nightsCount !== 'number' ||
    49â†’    isNaN(nightsCount) ||
    50â†’    nightsCount < 2 ||
    51â†’    nightsCount > 7
    52â†’  ) {
    53â†’    throw new Error(
    54â†’      `calculateGuestFacingPrice: nightsCount must be between 2-7, got ${nightsCount}`
    55â†’    )
    56â†’  }
    57â†’
    58â†’  // Step 1: Calculate base price (host rate Ã— nights)
    59â†’  const basePrice = hostNightlyRate * nightsCount
    60â†’
    61â†’  // Step 2: Apply full-time discount (only for 7 nights)
    62â†’  const fullTimeDiscount = nightsCount === PRICING_CONSTANTS.FULL_TIME_NIGHTS_THRESHOLD
    63â†’    ? basePrice * PRICING_CONSTANTS.FULL_TIME_DISCOUNT_RATE
    64â†’    : 0;
    65â†’
    66â†’  // Step 3: Price after discounts
    67â†’  const priceAfterDiscounts = basePrice - fullTimeDiscount;
    68â†’
    69â†’  // Step 4: Apply site markup
    70â†’  const siteMarkup = priceAfterDiscounts * PRICING_CONSTANTS.SITE_MARKUP_RATE;
    71â†’
    72â†’  // Step 5: Calculate total price
    73â†’  const totalPrice = basePrice - fullTimeDiscount + siteMarkup
    74â†’
    75â†’  // Step 6: Calculate price per night (guest-facing price)
    76â†’  const pricePerNight = totalPrice / nightsCount
    77â†’
    78â†’  return pricePerNight
    79â†’}
    80â†’

1â†’/**
     2â†’ * Check if selected days form a contiguous (consecutive) block.
     3â†’ *
     4â†’ * @intent Enforce the business rule that split lease stays must be consecutive nights.
     5â†’ * @rule Days must be consecutive (Mon-Fri âœ“, Mon+Wed âœ—).
     6â†’ * @rule Handles week wrap-around cases (Fri-Sun âœ“, Sat-Tue âœ“).
     7â†’ * @rule For wrap-around, uses inverse logic: if unselected days are contiguous, selected days wrap around properly.
     8â†’ * @rule 6 or more days is always contiguous (only 1 gap maximum).
     9â†’ *
    10â†’ * This function consolidates the contiguous validation logic that previously existed in:
    11â†’ * - availabilityValidation.js (isContiguousSelection)
    12â†’ * - scheduleSelector/validators.js (isContiguous)
    13â†’ *
    14â†’ * @param {object} params - Named parameters.
    15â†’ * @param {number[]} params.selectedDayIndices - Array of day indices (0=Sunday, 1=Monday, ..., 6=Saturday).
    16â†’ * @returns {boolean} True if days are contiguous, false otherwise.
    17â†’ *
    18â†’ * @throws {Error} If selectedDayIndices is not an array.
    19â†’ * @throws {Error} If any day index is invalid (not 0-6).
    20â†’ *
    21â†’ * @example
    22â†’ * isScheduleContiguous({ selectedDayIndices: [1, 2, 3, 4, 5] }) // => true (Mon-Fri)
    23â†’ * isScheduleContiguous({ selectedDayIndices: [1, 3, 5] }) // => false (Mon, Wed, Fri - not contiguous)
    24â†’ * isScheduleContiguous({ selectedDayIndices: [5, 6, 0] }) // => true (Fri-Sun, wraps around week)
    25â†’ * isScheduleContiguous({ selectedDayIndices: [6, 0, 1, 2] }) // => true (Sat-Tue, wraps around week)
    26â†’ */
    27â†’export function isScheduleContiguous({ selectedDayIndices }) {
    28â†’  // No Fallback: Validate input
    29â†’  if (!Array.isArray(selectedDayIndices)) {
    30â†’    throw new Error(
    31â†’      `isScheduleContiguous: selectedDayIndices must be an array, got ${typeof selectedDayIndices}`
    32â†’    )
    33â†’  }
    34â†’
    35â†’  // Empty selection is not contiguous
    36â†’  if (selectedDayIndices.length === 0) {
    37â†’    return false
    38â†’  }
    39â†’
    40â†’  // Single day is contiguous
    41â†’  if (selectedDayIndices.length === 1) {
    42â†’    return true
    43â†’  }
    44â†’
    45â†’  // Validate all day indices
    46â†’  for (const day of selectedDayIndices) {
    47â†’    if (typeof day !== 'number' || isNaN(day) || day < 0 || day > 6) {
    48â†’      throw new Error(
    49â†’        `isScheduleContiguous: Invalid day index ${day}, must be 0-6`
    50â†’      )
    51â†’    }
    52â†’  }
    53â†’
    54â†’  // Sort the selected days
    55â†’  const sorted = [...selectedDayIndices].sort((a, b) => a - b)
    56â†’
    57â†’  // If 6 or more days selected, it's contiguous (only 1 gap or no gaps)
    58â†’  if (sorted.length >= 6) {
    59â†’    return true
    60â†’  }
    61â†’
    62â†’  // Check for standard contiguous sequence (no wrap around)
    63â†’  let isStandardContiguous = true
    64â†’  for (let i = 1; i < sorted.length; i++) {
    65â†’    if (sorted[i] !== sorted[i - 1] + 1) {
    66â†’      isStandardContiguous = false
    67â†’      break
    68â†’    }
    69â†’  }
    70â†’
    71â†’  if (isStandardContiguous) {
    72â†’    return true
    73â†’  }
    74â†’
    75â†’  // Check if selection includes both Sunday (0) and Saturday (6) - wrap-around case
    76â†’  const hasZero = sorted.includes(0)
    77â†’  const hasSix = sorted.includes(6)
    78â†’
    79â†’  if (hasZero && hasSix) {
    80â†’    // Week wrap-around case: use inverse logic (check not-selected days)
    81â†’    // If the NOT selected days are contiguous, then selected days wrap around and are contiguous
    82â†’    const allDays = [0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6]
    83â†’    const notSelectedDays = allDays.filter(d => !sorted.includes(d))
    84â†’
    85â†’    if (notSelectedDays.length === 0) {
    86â†’      return true // All days selected
    87â†’    }
    88â†’
    89â†’    // Check if not-selected days form a contiguous block
    90â†’    const minNotSelected = Math.min(...notSelectedDays)
    91â†’    const maxNotSelected = Math.max(...notSelectedDays)
    92â†’
    93â†’    // Generate expected contiguous range for not-selected days
    94â†’    const expectedNotSelected = []
    95â†’    for (let i = minNotSelected; i <= maxNotSelected; i++) {
    96â†’      expectedNotSelected.push(i)
    97â†’    }
    98â†’
    99â†’    // If not-selected days are contiguous, then selected days wrap around properly
   100â†’    const notSelectedContiguous = notSelectedDays.length === expectedNotSelected.length &&
   101â†’      notSelectedDays.every((day, index) => day === expectedNotSelected[index])
   102â†’
   103â†’    return notSelectedContiguous

/**
 * Process raw proposal data from Supabase into a clean, validated proposal object.
 *
 * @intent Transform raw proposal rows from Supabase into consistent, UI-ready format.
 * @rule NO FALLBACK - Throws explicit errors for missing critical fields.
 * @rule Merges original terms and counteroffer (host-changed) terms into single current terms.
 * @rule Handles dual proposal system (original vs host counteroffer).
 *
 * @param {object} params - Named parameters.
 * @param {object} params.rawProposal - Raw proposal object from Supabase.
 * @param {object} [params.listing] - Processed listing data (if already loaded).
 * @param {object} [params.guest] - Processed guest user data (if already loaded).
 * @param {object} [params.host] - Processed host user data (if already loaded).
 * @returns {object} Clean, validated proposal object with merged terms.
 *
 * @throws {Error} If rawProposal is null/undefined.
 * @throws {Error} If critical _id field is missing.
 * @throws {Error} If Listing or Guest reference is missing.
 *
 * @example
 * const proposal = processProposalData({
 *   rawProposal: {
 *     _id: 'abc123',
 *     Listing: 'listing123',
 *     Guest: 'user456',
 *     'Move-In Date': '2025-01-15',
 *     'Days of Week': [1, 2, 3],
 *     'hc Days of Week': null,
 *     'Proposal Status': 'Host Countered',
 *     ...
 *   }
 * })
 */
import { PROPOSAL_STATUSES, getUsualOrder } from '../../constants/proposalStatuses.js'

export function processProposalData({ rawProposal, listing = null, guest = null, host = null }) {
  // No Fallback: Proposal data must exist
  if (!rawProposal) {
    throw new Error('processProposalData: rawProposal cannot be null or undefined')
  }

  // Validate critical ID field
  if (!rawProposal._id) {
    throw new Error('processProposalData: Proposal missing critical _id field')
  }

  // Validate required foreign key references
  if (!rawProposal.Listing) {
    throw new Error(
      `processProposalData: Proposal ${rawProposal._id} missing required Listing reference`
    )
  }

  if (!rawProposal.Guest) {
    throw new Error(
      `processProposalData: Proposal ${rawProposal._id} missing required Guest reference`
    )
  }

  // Determine which terms are current (original or host-changed)
  const status = typeof rawProposal.Status === 'string'
    ? rawProposal.Status.trim()
    : (typeof rawProposal.status === 'string' ? rawProposal.status.trim() : 'Draft')

  const hasHostCounteroffer = status === PROPOSAL_STATUSES.COUNTEROFFER_SUBMITTED_AWAITING_GUEST_REVIEW.key.trim()

  // Merge terms: Use host-changed (hc) fields if they exist, otherwise use original
  const currentTerms = {
    moveInDate: hasHostCounteroffer && rawProposal['hc Move-In Date']
      ? rawProposal['hc Move-In Date']
      : rawProposal['Move-In Date'],

    daysOfWeek: hasHostCounteroffer && rawProposal['hc Days of Week']
      ? rawProposal['hc Days of Week']
      : rawProposal['Days of Week'],

    weeks: hasHostCounteroffer && rawProposal['hc Weeks']
      ? rawProposal['hc Weeks']
      : rawProposal.Weeks,

    totalRent: hasHostCounteroffer && rawProposal['hc Total Rent']
      ? rawProposal['hc Total Rent']
      : rawProposal['Total Rent'],

    cleaningFee: hasHostCounteroffer && rawProposal['hc Cleaning Fee']
      ? rawProposal['hc Cleaning Fee']
      : rawProposal['Cleaning Fee'],

    securityDeposit: hasHostCounteroffer && rawProposal['hc Security Deposit']
      ? rawProposal['hc Security Deposit']
      : rawProposal['Security Deposit'],

    houseRules: hasHostCounteroffer && rawProposal['hc House Rules']
      ? rawProposal['hc House Rules']
      : rawProposal['House Rules'],

    moveOutDate: hasHostCounteroffer && rawProposal['hc Move-Out Date']
      ? rawProposal['hc Move-Out Date']
      : rawProposal['Move-Out Date']
  }

  // Preserve original terms for comparison
  const originalTerms = {
    moveInDate: rawProposal['Move-In Date'],
    daysOfWeek: rawProposal['Days of Week'],
    weeks: rawProposal.Weeks,
    totalRent: rawProposal['Total Rent'],
    cleaningFee: rawProposal['Cleaning Fee'],
    securityDeposit: rawProposal['Security Deposit'],
    houseRules: rawProposal['House Rules'],
    moveOutDate: rawProposal['Move-Out Date']
  }

  return {
    // Identity
    id: rawProposal._id,
    listingId: rawProposal.Listing,
    guestId: rawProposal.Guest,

    // Status and workflow
    status,
    deleted: rawProposal.Deleted === true,
    usualOrder: getUsualOrder(status),

    // Current terms (merged from original or counteroffer)
    currentTerms,

    // Original terms (for comparison in Compare Terms modal)
    originalTerms,
    hasCounteroffer: hasHostCounteroffer,

    // Additional details
    virtualMeetingId: rawProposal['virtual meeting'] || null,
    houseManualAccessed: rawProposal['Did user access house manual?'] === true,

    // Cancellation
    cancellationReason: rawProposal['reason for cancellation'] || null,

    // Timestamps
    createdDate: rawProposal['Created Date'],
    modifiedDate: rawProposal['Modified Date'],

    // Enriched data (if provided)
    _listing: listing,
    _guest: guest,
    _host: host
  }
}

content.content:
1â†’/**
     2â†’ * Proposal Data Processor
     3â†’ *
     4â†’ * PILLAR III: Data Processors (The "Truth" Layer)
     5â†’ *
     6â†’ * This processor transforms raw Supabase/Bubble.io data into clean,
     7â†’ * validated internal shapes. It enforces the "No Fallback" principle
     8â†’ * by throwing explicit errors for missing critical data.
     9â†’ *
    10â†’ * Intent: Create safe, typed objects for UI consumption, enforcing data integrity.
    11â†’ */
    12â†’
    13â†’/**
    14â†’ * Transform raw user data from Bubble.io format
    15â†’ * @param {Object} rawUser - Raw user object from Supabase
    16â†’ * @returns {Object} Transformed user object
    17â†’ */
    18â†’export function processUserData(rawUser) {
    19â†’  if (!rawUser) {
    20â†’    throw new Error('processUserData: User data is required');
    21â†’  }
    22â†’
    23â†’  if (!rawUser._id) {
    24â†’    throw new Error('processUserData: User ID (_id) is required');
    25â†’  }
    26â†’
    27â†’  return {
    28â†’    id: rawUser._id,
    29â†’    firstName: rawUser['Name - First'] || null,
    30â†’    lastName: rawUser['Name - Last'] || null,
    31â†’    fullName: rawUser['Name - Full'] || null,
    32â†’    profilePhoto: rawUser['Profile Photo'] || null,
    33â†’    bio: rawUser['About Me / Bio'] || null,
    34â†’    linkedInVerified: rawUser['Verify - Linked In ID'] || false,
    35â†’    phoneVerified: rawUser['Verify - Phone'] || false,
    36â†’    userVerified: rawUser['user verified?'] || false,
    37â†’    proposalsList: rawUser['Proposals List'] || []
    38â†’  };
    39â†’}
    40â†’
    41â†’/**
    42â†’ * Transform raw listing data from Bubble.io format
    43â†’ * @param {Object} rawListing - Raw listing object from Supabase
    44â†’ * @returns {Object} Transformed listing object
    45â†’ */
    46â†’export function processListingData(rawListing) {
    47â†’  if (!rawListing) {
    48â†’    return null;
    49â†’  }
    50â†’
    51â†’  // Extract address from JSONB structure
    52â†’  const addressData = rawListing['Location - Address'];
    53â†’  const addressString = typeof addressData === 'object' && addressData?.address
    54â†’    ? addressData.address
    55â†’    : (typeof addressData === 'string' ? addressData : null);
    56â†’
    57â†’  return {
    58â†’    id: rawListing._id,
    59â†’    name: rawListing.Name || 'Untitled Listing',
    60â†’    description: rawListing.Description || null,
    61â†’    address: addressString,
    62â†’    addressData: addressData, // Keep full JSONB for map coordinates
    63â†’    borough: rawListing['Location - Borough'] || null,
    64â†’    hood: rawListing['Location - Hood'] || null,
    65â†’    boroughName: rawListing.boroughName || null, // Resolved name from lookup table
    66â†’    hoodName: rawListing.hoodName || null, // Resolved name from lookup table
    67â†’    photos: rawListing['Features - Photos'] || [],
    68â†’    featuredPhotoUrl: rawListing.featuredPhotoUrl || null,
    69â†’    houseRules: rawListing.houseRules || [],
    70â†’    checkInTime: rawListing['NEW Date Check-in Time'] || null,
    71â†’    checkOutTime: rawListing['NEW Date Check-out Time'] || null,
    72â†’    hostUserId: rawListing['Host User'] || null
    73â†’  };
    74â†’}
    75â†’
    76â†’/**
    77â†’ * Transform raw host data from Bubble.io format
    78â†’ * @param {Object} rawHost - Raw host object from Supabase
    79â†’ * @returns {Object} Transformed host object
    80â†’ */
    81â†’export function processHostData(rawHost) {
    82â†’  if (!rawHost) {
    83â†’    return null;
    84â†’  }
    85â†’
    86â†’  return {
    87â†’    id: rawHost._id,
    88â†’    firstName: rawHost['Name - First'] || null,
    89â†’    lastName: rawHost['Name - Last'] || null,
    90â†’    fullName: rawHost['Name - Full'] || null,
    91â†’    profilePhoto: rawHost['Profile Photo'] || null,
    92â†’    bio: rawHost['About Me / Bio'] || null,
    93â†’    linkedInVerified: rawHost['Verify - Linked In ID'] || false,
    94â†’    phoneVerified: rawHost['Verify - Phone'] || false,
    95â†’    userVerified: rawHost['user verified?'] || false,
    96â†’    // hostUserId same as user._id after migration (Host User column contains user._id directly)
    97â†’    hostUserId: rawHost._id || null
    98â†’  };
    99â†’}
   100â†’
   101â†’/**
   102â†’ * Transform raw virtual meeting data from Bubble.io format
   103â†’ * @param {Object} rawVirtualMeeting - Raw virtual meeting object from Supabase
   104â†’ * @returns {Object} Transformed virtual meeting object
   105â†’ */
   106â†’export function processVirtualMeetingData(rawVirtualMeeting) {
   107â†’  if (!rawVirtualMeeting) {
   108â†’    return null;
   109â†’  }
   110â†’
   111â†’  return {
   112â†’    id: rawVirtualMeeting._id,
   113â†’    bookedDate: rawVirtualMeeting['booked date'] || null,
   114â†’    confirmedBySplitlease: rawVirtualMeeting.confirmedBySplitLease || false,
   115â†’    meetingLink: rawVirtualMeeting['meeting link'] || null,
   116â†’    meetingDeclined: rawVirtualMeeting['meeting declined'] || false,
   117â†’    requestedBy: rawVirtualMeeting['requested by'] || null,
   118â†’    suggestedTimeslots: rawVirtualMeeting['suggested dates and times'] || [],
   119â†’    guestName: rawVirtualMeeting['guest name'] || null,
   120â†’    hostName: rawVirtualMeeting['host name'] || null,
   121â†’    proposalId: rawVirtualMeeting.proposal || null,
   122â†’    uniqueId: rawVirtualMeeting.unique_id || null
   123â†’  };
   124â†’}
   125â†’
   126â†’/**
   127â†’ * Transform complete proposal data from Bubble.io format
   128â†’ * Includes nested transformations for listing, host, and virtual meeting
   129â†’ *
   130â†’ * @param {Object} rawProposal - Raw proposal object from Supabase
   131â†’ * @returns {Object} Transformed proposal object
   132â†’ */
   133â†’export function processProposalData(rawProposal) {
   134â†’  if (!rawProposal) {
   135â†’    throw new Error('processProposalData: Proposal data is required');
   136â†’  }
   137â†’
   138â†’  if (!rawProposal._id) {
   139â†’    throw new Error('processProposalData: Proposal ID (_id) is required');
   140â†’  }
   141â†’
   142â†’  // Extract and transform nested data
   143â†’  const listing = processListingData(rawProposal.listing);
   144â†’  const host = processHostData(rawProposal.listing?.host);
   145â†’  const virtualMeeting = processVirtualMeetingData(rawProposal.virtualMeeting);
   146â†’
   147â†’  return {
   148â†’    // Core identifiers
   149â†’    id: rawProposal._id,
   150â†’    _id: rawProposal._id, // Keep for compatibility
   151â†’
   152â†’    // Status and state
   153â†’    status: rawProposal.Status || 'Unknown',
   154â†’    deleted: rawProposal.Deleted || false,
   155â†’
   156â†’    // Schedule - Original proposal terms
   157â†’    daysSelected: rawProposal['Days Selected'] || [],
   158â†’    nightsSelected: rawProposal['Nights Selected (Nights list)'] || [],
   159â†’    reservationWeeks: rawProposal['Reservation Span (Weeks)'] || 0,
   160â†’    nightsPerWeek: rawProposal['nights per week (num)'] || 0,
   161â†’    checkInDay: rawProposal['check in day'] || null,
   162â†’    checkOutDay: rawProposal['check out day'] || null,
   163â†’    moveInStart: rawProposal['Move in range start'] || null,
   164â†’    moveInEnd: rawProposal['Move in range end'] || null,
   165â†’
   166â†’    // Pricing - Original proposal terms
   167â†’    totalPrice: rawProposal['Total Price for Reservation (guest)'] || 0,
   168â†’    nightlyPrice: rawProposal['proposal nightly price'] || 0,
   169â†’    cleaningFee: rawProposal['cleaning fee'] || 0,
   170â†’    damageDeposit: rawProposal['damage deposit'] || 0,
   171â†’
   172â†’    // Counteroffer fields (hc = host-changed)
   173â†’    counterOfferHappened: rawProposal['counter offer happened'] || false,
   174â†’    hcDaysSelected: rawProposal['hc days selected'] || null,
   175â†’    hcReservationWeeks: rawProposal['hc reservation span (weeks)'] || null,
   176â†’    hcNightsPerWeek: rawProposal['hc nights per week'] || null,
   177â†’    hcCheckInDay: rawProposal['hc check in day'] || null,
   178â†’    hcCheckOutDay: rawProposal['hc check out day'] || null,
   179â†’    hcTotalPrice: rawProposal['hc total price'] || null,
   180â†’    hcNightlyPrice: rawProposal['hc nightly price'] || null,
   181â†’    hcCleaningFee: rawProposal['hc cleaning fee'] || null,
   182â†’    hcDamageDeposit: rawProposal['hc damage deposit'] || null,
   183â†’    hcHouseRules: rawProposal['hc house rules'] || null,
   184â†’
   185â†’    // Metadata
   186â†’    createdDate: rawProposal['Created Date'] || null,
   187â†’    modifiedDate: rawProposal['Modified Date'] || null,
   188â†’    aboutYourself: rawProposal.about_yourself || null,
   189â†’    specialNeeds: rawProposal.special_needs || null,
   190â†’    reasonForCancellation: rawProposal['reason for cancellation'] || null,
   191â†’    proposalStage: rawProposal['Proposal Stage'] || null,
   192â†’    isFinalized: rawProposal['Is Finalized'] || false,
   193â†’    isSuggestedByHost: rawProposal['Is Suggested by Host'] || false,
   194â†’
   195â†’    // Related IDs
   196â†’    guestId: rawProposal.Guest || null,
   197â†’    listingId: rawProposal.Listing || null,
   198â†’    rentalApplicationId: rawProposal['rental application'] || null,
   199â†’    virtualMeetingId: rawProposal['virtual meeting'] || null,
   200â†’
   201â†’    // Nested transformed data
   202â†’    listing,
   203â†’    host,
   204â†’    virtualMeeting,
   205â†’
   206â†’    // House rules (resolved from listing or counteroffer)
   207â†’    houseRules: rawProposal.houseRules || listing?.houseRules || []
   208â†’  };
   209â†’}
   210â†’
   211â†’/**
   212â†’ * Get display text for proposal in dropdown
   213â†’ * Format: "{host name} - {listing name}"
   214â†’ * Shows the host who owns the listing, allowing guests to identify proposals by host
   215â†’ *
   216â†’ * @param {Object} proposal - Transformed proposal object
   217â†’ * @returns {string} Display text for dropdown option
   218â†’ */
   219â†’export function getProposalDisplayText(proposal) {
   220â†’  if (!proposal) return 'Unknown Proposal';
   221â†’
   222â†’  const hostName = proposal.host?.firstName || proposal.host?.fullName || 'Host';
   223â†’  const listingName = proposal.listing?.name || 'Property';
   224â†’
   225â†’  return `${hostName} - ${listingName}`;
   226â†’}
   227â†’
   228â†’/**
   229â†’ * Format price for display
   230â†’ * @param {number} price - Price value
   231â†’ * @param {boolean} includeCents - Whether to include cents
   232â†’ * @returns {string} Formatted price string
   233â†’ */
   234â†’export function formatPrice(price, includeCents = true) {
   235â†’  if (price === null || price === undefined) return null;

1â†’/**
     2â†’ * Workflow: Cancel a proposal with complex decision tree.
     3â†’ *
     4â†’ * @intent Orchestrate proposal cancellation following business rules.
     5â†’ * @rule Implements complete cancellation decision tree (7 variations).
     6â†’ * @rule Different actions based on: source, current status, usual order, house manual access.
     7â†’ * @rule Updates Supabase with appropriate status and cancellation reason.
     8â†’ *
     9â†’ * Decision Tree (from WORKFLOW-PASS2-ASSIMILATION.md):
    10â†’ * 1. Already cancelled â†’ Show alert, no action
    11â†’ * 2. Compare modal source + Usual Order â‰¤5 â†’ Status: "Cancelled by Guest"
    12â†’ * 3. Compare modal source + Usual Order >5 â†’ Alert to call, no DB update
    13â†’ * 4. Main page + Usual Order â‰¤5 + No house manual â†’ Status: "Cancelled by Guest"
    14â†’ * 5. Main page + Usual Order >5 + No house manual â†’ Alert to call, no DB update
    15â†’ * 6. Main page + Usual Order â‰¤5 + Has house manual â†’ Alert to call, no DB update
    16â†’ * 7. Main page + Usual Order >5 + Has house manual â†’ Alert to call, no DB update
    17â†’ *
    18â†’ * @param {object} params - Named parameters.
    19â†’ * @param {object} params.supabase - Supabase client instance.
    20â†’ * @param {object} params.proposal - Processed proposal object.
    21â†’ * @param {string} params.source - 'main' | 'compare-modal' | 'other'.
    22â†’ * @param {function} params.canCancelProposal - Rule function to check if cancellable.
    23â†’ * @returns {Promise<object>} Result object with success status and message.
    24â†’ *
    25â†’ * @throws {Error} If required parameters are missing.
    26â†’ *
    27â†’ * @example
    28â†’ * const result = await cancelProposalWorkflow({
    29â†’ *   supabase,
    30â†’ *   proposal: processedProposal,
    31â†’ *   source: 'main',
    32â†’ *   canCancelProposal
    33â†’ * })
    34â†’ * // => { success: true, message: 'Proposal cancelled', updated: true }
    35â†’ */
    36â†’import { PROPOSAL_STATUSES } from '../../constants/proposalStatuses.js'
    37â†’
    38â†’export async function cancelProposalWorkflow({
    39â†’  supabase,
    40â†’  proposal,
    41â†’  source = 'main',
    42â†’  canCancelProposal
    43â†’}) {
    44â†’  // Validation
    45â†’  if (!supabase) {
    46â†’    throw new Error('cancelProposalWorkflow: supabase client is required')
    47â†’  }
    48â†’
    49â†’  if (!proposal || !proposal.id) {
    50â†’    throw new Error('cancelProposalWorkflow: proposal with id is required')
    51â†’  }
    52â†’
    53â†’  if (!canCancelProposal) {
    54â†’    throw new Error('cancelProposalWorkflow: canCancelProposal rule function is required')
    55â†’  }
    56â†’
    57â†’  // Step 1: Check if cancellation is allowed
    58â†’  const canCancel = canCancelProposal({
    59â†’    proposalStatus: proposal.status,
    60â†’    deleted: proposal.deleted
    61â†’  })
    62â†’
    63â†’  if (!canCancel) {
    64â†’    return {
    65â†’      success: false,
    66â†’      message: 'This proposal cannot be cancelled (already in terminal state)',
    67â†’      updated: false
    68â†’    }
    69â†’  }
    70â†’
    71â†’  // Step 2: Extract decision factors
    72â†’  const usualOrder = proposal.usualOrder || 0
    73â†’  const hasAccessedHouseManual = proposal.houseManualAccessed === true
    74â†’  const isFromCompareModal = source === 'compare-modal'
    75â†’
    76â†’  // Step 3: Apply decision tree
    77â†’  let shouldUpdateDatabase = false
    78â†’  let alertMessage = null
    79â†’
    80â†’  if (isFromCompareModal) {
    81â†’    // Compare Modal Source
    82â†’    if (usualOrder <= 5) {
    83â†’      // Variation 2: Update database
    84â†’      shouldUpdateDatabase = true
    85â†’    } else {
    86â†’      // Variation 3: Alert to call
    87â†’      alertMessage = 'Please call Split Lease to cancel this proposal (Usual Order > 5)'
    88â†’    }
    89â†’  } else {
    90â†’    // Main Page Source
    91â†’    if (!hasAccessedHouseManual) {
    92â†’      if (usualOrder <= 5) {
    93â†’        // Variation 4: Update database
    94â†’        shouldUpdateDatabase = true
    95â†’      } else {
    96â†’        // Variation 5: Alert to call
    97â†’        alertMessage = 'Please call Split Lease to cancel this proposal (Usual Order > 5)'
    98â†’      }
    99â†’    } else {
   100â†’      // Has accessed house manual - always alert to call (Variations 6 & 7)
   101â†’      alertMessage = 'Please call Split Lease to cancel this proposal (House Manual accessed)'
   102â†’    }
   103â†’  }
   104â†’
   105â†’  // Step 4: Execute action
   106â†’  if (shouldUpdateDatabase) {
   107â†’    try {
   108â†’      const { error } = await supabase
   109â†’        .from('proposal')
   110â†’        .update({
   111â†’          'Status': PROPOSAL_STATUSES.CANCELLED_BY_GUEST.key,
   112â†’          'reason for cancellation': 'Guest initiated cancellation',
   113â†’          'Modified Date': new Date().toISOString()
   114â†’        })
   115â†’        .eq('_id', proposal.id)
   116â†’
   117â†’      if (error) {
   118â†’        throw error
   119â†’      }
   120â†’
   121â†’      return {
   122â†’        success: true,
   123â†’        message: 'Proposal cancelled successfully',
   124â†’        updated: true
   125â†’      }
   126â†’    } catch (err) {
   127â†’      return {
   128â†’        success: false,
   129â†’        message: `Failed to cancel proposal: ${err.message}`,
   130â†’        updated: false,
   131â†’        error: err
   132â†’      }
   133â†’    }
   134â†’  } else {
   135â†’    // Alert only, no database update
   136â†’    return {
   137â†’      success: true,
   138â†’      message: alertMessage,
   139â†’      updated: false,
   140â†’      requiresPhoneCall: true
   141â†’    }
   142â†’  }
   143â†’}
   144â†’
